title: axum's `handle_error` feature increases compile times significantly

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I was [recently made aware](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/issues/145) that axum's [`handle_error` feature](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum/blob/main/src/routing/mod.rs#L419) significantly increase compile times. You can find a reproduction script [here](https://github.com/davidpdrsn/axum-handle-error-slow-compile).

I'm wondering if this is a known issue in rustc and if there is something I can do in axum to improve things (I'm the maintainer of axum). I don't have any experience debugging slow compile times so not sure how to approach this problem.

For context: [axum](https://github.com/tokio-rs/axum) is a web framework that works by composing many [`tower::Service`s](https://docs.rs/tower/0.4.8/tower/trait.Service.html) (similarly to composing `Iterator` adaptors). This leads to large types with lots of generic type parameters. Compile times have been fine until now but for some reason `handle_error` in particular seems to slow things down.

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.54.0 (a178d0322 2021-07-26)

commit-date: 2021-07-26
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.54.0
LLVM version: 12.0.1
```
